author: Staff Reporter
text:
Policemen pacifying workers who had thronged the private consulting firm at Annai Teresa Nagar at Moolakulam.- Photo: S.S. Kumar

Around 40 persons from the city who had recently returned from Qatar on Tuesday stormed into the branch office of a private consulting firm and contractor at Reddiyarpalayam demanding compensation from the company headquartered in Qatar for causing substantial loss to them.

The protesters alleged they were sent on contract to the private construction company at Ras Laffan in Qatar. They were promised a decent salary and good ccommodation.

Various jobs assured

They were also assured that they would be engaged as electricians, electrical foreman, plumbers, supervisors and safety officers in Qatar.

However, the employees were allegedly forced to work for over 14 hours a day. They were not provided food and given meagre salaries.

The protestors claimed that they got in touch with the Indian Embassy before they returned to Puducherry recently.

On Tuesday, they marched into the branch office of the consulting firm and raised slogans against the employer for cheating them.

On information police personnel rushed to the spot and pacified them following which they withdrew their protest.

However, the staff at the company showed the media, copies of show cause notices sent to some of its contract staff seeking explanation on what it alleged to be a deliberate act of “incomplete commissioning” of a chiller plant at a warehouse in Ras Laffan with intention to damage the plant.

The company has threatened to initiate legal proceedings against the staff for violating the employment contract.
title: Contract workers accuse consulting firm of cheating
